basics.name: Hayeon Jeong
basics.label: MS Student
basics.summary: I am an MS student in the Multimedia Computing & Machine Learning (MCML) group at Yonsei University, advised by Prof. Jong-Seok Lee. My research interests include Diffusion Models, Unfied Multi-Modal Models in Computer Vision.

publications.name: Dominating vs. Dominated: Generative Collapse in Diffusion Models
publications.summary: We identify and analyze the Dominant-vs-Dominated (DvD) imbalance in text-to-image diffusion models, where one concept suppresses others in multi-concept generation. Through a systematic benchmark and attention-level analysis, we show that this behavior arises from limited data diversity and distributed cross-attention mechanisms, providing insights toward more reliable and controllable image generation.

publications.name: Infrared Thermal-Guided Adversarial Patch Defense for Robust Visible Person Detectors
publications.summary: We propose a defense against adversarial patch attacks on visible person detectors by leveraging infrared thermal information. By exploiting thermal differences between humans and adversarial patches, our method effectively detects and mitigates physical attacks while preserving performance on clean images.

projects.name: Phonetic-Aware Encoder Tuning for L2 Korean ASR
projects.summary: Designed a robust ASR framework mitigating phonetic disruption in non-native Korean speech via LoRA-adapted Whisper encoder and auxiliary CTC-based phonetic supervision.

honors and awards.title: Professor’s Scholarship (Half Tuition)
honors and awards.awarder: School of Electronic Engineering, Soongsil University

volunteer.summary: Contributed to community safety improvements through CCTV installation project with local police station, and participated in youth education volunteer programs.

references.name: Jong-Seok Lee
references.reference: Jong-Seok Lee is a professor of computer science at Yonsei University. He is a co-author of the paper 'Dominating vs. Dominated: Generative Collapse in Diffusion Models'.
